verses.verse: If only you were like a brother to me, like {The Heb. lacks like} one who nursed at my mother's breasts. If I found you outside I would kiss you, and no one would view me with contempt. {I. e. think badly of me}

I would lead you, I would bring you to the house of my mother who used to teach me. I would give you some spiced wine to drink, from the juice of my pomegranates. {Or some of my sweet pomegranate wine}
Let his left hand be under my head, and let his right hand embrace me.
Swear to me, young women of Jerusalem, that you won't awaken or arouse love before its proper time! {Lit. until it pleases}

{The Young Women} d Who is this coming up from the desert, leaning on her beloved? {The Loved One} d Under the apple tree {Or apricot tree} I awakened you. There your mother had gone into labor with you; there she went into labor and gave birth to you.

Set me like a seal {I. e. a cylinder seal or a signet ring used to indicate ownership or authority} over your heart, like a seal on your arm. For love is as strong as death, passion {Or jealousy} as intense as Sheol. {I. e. the realm of the dead} The flames of love {Lit. its flames} are flames of fire, a blaze that comes from the Lord . {Or an intense blaze}
Mighty bodies of water cannot extinguish love, rivers cannot put it out. If a man were to give all the wealth of his house for love, he would surely be viewed with contempt.

{The Loved One's Brothers} d We {I. e. the bride's brothers} have a little sister, and she has not yet reached maturity. {Lit. has no breasts} What will we do for our sister to prepare her for {Lit. sister on the day when she's spoken for} her engagement? {Or marriage}
If she's a wall, on her we will build a battlement of silver. If she's a door, we will enclose her with planks of cedar.
{The Loved One} d I was a wall and my breasts were like towers. Then I became like one who finds peace {Or contentment} in his eyes.
Solomon has a vineyard in Baal-hamon. He entrusted the vineyard to caretakers each one is to bring 1, pieces of silver in exchange for its fruit.
My vineyard belongs to me and is at my disposal. {Lit. is before me} The 1, are for you, Solomon, and 200 are for those who take care of its fruit.
{The Lover} d You who sit in the gardens, companions are listening for your voice, but let me hear it.
{The Loved One} d Come quickly, my beloved, and be like a gazelle or a young stag on the mountains of spices.
